page.title: 16HOOK NORTON - HOME LIFE
page.content: Mr. Beale's house is 250 years old. His Dad bought it for {l50 90 years ago. He has a big grandfather clock.It is over 100 years old and it only chimes the hours. It is a 30 hour clock and has a weight that Mr. Beale has to set every day.It has a removable top. His father bought it at an auction and he had to take it home piece by piece. He has a steelyard that was made in 1845 and it weighs pigs up to 340 pounds. In his attic he has a commode. It is a portable toilet, and old postcards and pictures of Hook Norton. He has wooden beams along the roof of the house and they are made of oak. In has cellar the air feels lighter. He has old cooking pots, a meat safe and some stone wine jars with trade names on.Mr. Beale makes his own wine.
